Articles.Content:
One of the tutorials I read said that collision meshes should be 255 polygons or less.

Is this just a guideline to keep performance good with lots of parts, or is there some problem with larger poly counts that I haven't encountered yet?

The first ship I did was about 1600 ploys after Unity triangulated it and I just reused the object mesh as the collider.

It worked in KSP, but it was a little laggy docking with my station. No sure if that was the stations fault or the ships though.

Anyone got any input on this subject?

The system will refuse a collider with greater than 255 tris, but for visible models the going rate is max 4000~, and it's not a hard limit but a performance limit, most player's computers can do parts at 4K without any significant hit.
